definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only

sentences.english: I learn English all by myself.
sentences.chinese: 我的英语是自学成才的。

sentences.english: Many young musicians in Iraq are self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克很多年轻音乐家都是自学成才的。

sentences.english: J. V. : There are very few self-educated pianists.
sentences.chinese: 自学成才的钢琴家是很少的。

sentences.english: All times and in all, many great people are relying on self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 古今中外，许多伟人都是靠自学成才的。

sentences.english: I understand you've learned a lot by yourself.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道你这家伙厉害，自学成才啊。

sentences.english: The reality is that many web professionals are self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 实际情况是，许多专业的网络技术人员都是自学成才。

sentences.english: "You need to add dirt and imperfections." Knowing how to do that takes time, especially if you are self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 知道如何去做需要时间，特别是如果你想要自学成才。

definition: switch to a job one was not trained for
to switch from one major or faculty to another (at a university)
A famous teacher trains a fine student (idiom). A cultured man will have a deep influence on his successors.
